metadata.feature_description: Manage which template is set as the default template for new pages

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Identify default template by visual indicator

steps.expected: Templates list should display with the default template visually highlighted
steps.actual: Templates list displayed with 'Cavalier - Main' template highlighted with a blue/cyan border, indicating it is the default template

steps.action: Hover over the default template (Cavalier - Main)
steps.expected: Template should show action buttons and visual feedback
steps.actual: Hovering shows template preview with blue border highlight. Only 'Edit' button appears (no Delete button)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Default template auto-selected when creating new template

steps.expected: Add Template dialog should open with default template pre-selected
steps.actual: Add Template dialog opened with 'Cavalier - Main' automatically selected (shown with green checkmark)

steps.action: Hover over the default template (Cavalier - Main)
steps.expected: Delete button should not be available for the default template
steps.actual: Only 'Edit' button appears when hovering over 'Cavalier - Main' - no Delete button is visible

steps.action: Hover over a non-default template (Test Template Page)
steps.expected: Both Edit and Delete buttons should be available
steps.actual: Both 'Edit' and 'Delete' buttons appear when hovering over 'Test Template Page', confirming non-default templates can be deleted

steps.action: Search for 'Set as Default' or similar option in the Templates UI
steps.expected: There should be a UI option to change the default template
steps.actual: No 'Set as Default' option found in the Templates panel. Code review confirms the default template is determined by the 'DefaultPortalSkin' portal setting which is managed in Site Settings > Themes, not in the Templates module

issues: No UI option exists in the Templates panel to change the default template. The default template is controlled via Site Settings > Themes (DefaultPortalSkin setting), which is outside the scope of this module.

observations: The default template is visually identified by a blue/cyan border around the template card in the list view
The default template ('Cavalier - Main') is automatically pre-selected with a green checkmark when creating a new template
The system prevents deletion of the default template by simply not showing the Delete button - this is an implicit protection rather than an explicit error message

Code review confirms: The default template is determined by the 'DefaultPortalSkin' portal setting (managed in Site Settings > Themes), not directly within the Templates module. The GetDefaultTemplateId method in TemplateController.cs looks for a template with Id='Default'
The 'Change default template' functionality is not available in the Templates UI - it requires navigating to a different module (Themes/Site Settings)
